clearance_req: U.S. citizenship or U.S. national status required
duty_station: NOAA Western Region (CA, OR, WA, ID, CO, UT, AZ, AK, HI)
responsiblities_sum: Participate in NOAA or partner projects in science, research, policy, management, communication, or education; attend weekly webinars; complete professional development workshops; conduct informational interviews; participate in field and lab activities; receive training for applying to NOAA internships and the Hollings Scholarship.
desired_education_sum: Undergraduate freshman at an accredited U.S. institution; 3.0+ GPA in final year of high school; interest in NOAA mission areas.
req_skills_sum: Basic data analysis; communication; teamwork; introductory scientific methods; time management.
pref_skills_sum: Interest in NOAA careers; early exposure to R statistical computing; engagement in environmental science or policy topics.
work_conditions_sum: Full-time internship; office, lab, and potential field settings; regional travel possible depending on host office.
application_components: Online application via NOAA Office of Education portal.
poss_project: NOAA science, research, policy, and education projects
poss_professdev: Professional development workshops; NOAA networking; R statistical training
pert_details_sum: Includes weekly NOAA webinars, resume and cover letter workshops, R computational course, and exposure to NOAA mission offices.
